item.description: Date: 8/30/24PWSID# 3303111Morgantown Utility Board (MUB) has issued a precautionary boil water advisory for approximately 6 customers at 874 to 918 Bakers Ridge Road.Once service is restored, affected customers will be advised to boil their water before consumption until the boil water advisory is lifted. When the system recovers, MUB will be collecting water quality samples in the area of the outage, which requires a minimum of 24 hours for analysis. Customers and the appropriate agencies will be notified in the same manner once the analysis is complete and the advisory can be lifted.In the meantime, please reach out to us with any questions or additional information that may be needed.Thank you.

item.title: TRAFFIC ALERTS: There are several events planned in Morganto
item.description: TRAFFIC ALERTS: There are several events planned in Morgantown today and tonight, along with the opening football game Saturday. You should expect delays in and around the downtown Morgantown area throughout the day. There will be an increase in vehicle traffic and foot traffic on Beechurst Ave., Campus Drive and University Ave., area today between 10am-4pm due to the Pat McAfee show being broadcast live at the life sciences building and Fox sports putting on events at the Mountain Lair. The lower half of River Road between the Westover Bridge and the entrance to the Dog Pound will be closed due to a fireworks display being set up for the last outside concert of the season and River Front park tonight downtown. All of these events combined, along with a sold out opening football game will create traffic delays that should be planned for today. Please be patient or use alternative routes if you have to travel around the downtown area of Morgantown today and tomorrow.

item.description: Date Issued: 8/28/24Date Lifted: 8/30/24PWSID# 3303111Morgantown Utility Board (MUB) has lifted a precautionary boil water advisory for approximately 41 customers at 101 to 1003 Lakeview Estate Townhomes.Results of the water quality testing have confirmed that the water quality meets drinking water standards. Therefore, there is no further need to boil water prior to consumption. Customers will be notified of the advisory lifting in the same manner as they were for the issuance.Please reach out to us with any questions or additional information that may be needed.Thank you.
